name: David Brackbill
title: Full-Stack Software Engineer
blurb: I'm passionate about building resilient infrastructure where correctness and performance matter.
summary: Full-stack software engineer with over 4 years of making users' hearts flutter. Passionate about building resilient infrastructure where correctness and performance matter. Educational background in machine learning and cloud computing.
about:
I'm a full-stack developer interested in systems engineering and machine learning. My professional journey has been shaped by diverse and challenging projects, including algorithms writing, predictive modeling and DAG orchestration.
I'm passionate about writing useful tools for end users and fellow developers. Roles that allow me to find and delight a niche need are what keep me coding. You can find me writing in whatever gets the job done; I have experience programming large systems in C/C++, JavaScript/TypeScript, and Python and am always looking to learn more tools.
When I'm not coding, chances are I'm reading some weird fiction or a text by Brian Kernighan. If you have any recommendations or job opportunities you think would be interesting to me, let's connect!

skills.frontend: React, TypeScript, Next.js, Astro, Tailwind CSS, HTML5, Svelte
skills.backend: C++, Python, Rust, Node.js, FastAPI, REST
skills.devopsTools: Docker, AWS, GitHub Actions, Kubernetes, Terraform

experience.title: Software Engineer
achievements: Conducted capacity‑planning exercises anticipating traffic spikes, provisioning resources to maintain sub-second P99 latency
Achieved 99.9% API uptime for backend services using Python & FastAPI, ensuring uninterrupted data access for thousands of downstream jobs
Orchestrated unified data infrastructure (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Neo4j, AWS S3), cutting cloud spend by 20% and improving resource utilization across staging and production
Reduced initial page load by 500ms and user checkout completion by 20% by optimizing page load order and developing automated workflows across the JS and Node.js codebases
Developed machine learning algorithms to automate data validation for semi structured data, increasing real coverage of California addresses by 150%

experience.title: Data Engineering Intern
achievements: Reduced P99 MySQL latency from 5s to 500 ms using in‑memory caching and payload bundling, increasing user responsiveness
Optimized ETL memory usage by streaming directly to S3, reducing EC2 memory costs by 15% and allowing concurrent user requests

education.details: Cloud Computing, Operating Systems, Computer Architecture, Human-Computer Interaction
Machine Learning, Data Structures & Algorithms, Database Systems
